title.narrative: Engagement with Private and Public Sectors to Improve Nutrition - EPPSIN

description.narrative: This programme will work with the private and public sector to build stable and resilient markets focussed on delivering more nutritious foods. A key underlying driver of malnutrition is poor quality diets. Recent evidence suggests the main barriers to achieving good nutrition in Pakistan include - a lack of affordability of a nutritious diet, a lack of information and knowledge of nutritious foods, and limited access to markets. Food systems have a key role in improving diet quantity and quality, as they affect the availability, affordability, and demand for nutritious food. They encompass everything from food production, storage, distribution, processing, marketing and retailing. But food systems in Pakistan are currently broken, they do not prioritise the supply and demand for nutritious foods
